name: Niklas Elmqvist
bio: Niklas Elmqvist is a Villum Investigator and Full Professor in the Department of Computer Science at Aarhus University, Denmark. He serves as the Director of the Center for Anytime Anywhere Analytics (CA3), a research center focused on AR/XR for data visualization. Niklas has long experience in patterns and best practices for evaluating data visualization.

name: Tobias Isenberg
bio: Tobias Isenberg is a Senior Research Scientist with Inria at its Paris-Saclay campus. Tobias’s exceptional expertise in interactive scientific visualization and illustrative rendering will lead the discussions on how different visualization systems may necessitate varying evaluation approaches.

name: Rita Borgo
bio: Rita Borgo is an Associate Professor at Kings College London and head of the Human-Centered Computing Group. Rita’s valuable insights on how to design user studies, methodologies, and environment will lead discussion on evaluation strategies, drawing from her extensive experience in human-centered computing.

name: Michael Sedlmair
bio: Michael Sedlmair is a Professor at the University of Stuttgart and leads the research group for Visualization and VR/AR. Michael’s expertise with different types of methods in HCI, Vis, and VR/AR will significantly contribute to the discussion on how these methods can impact and benefit the count of evaluations in visualization systems studies.
